title: (x) Melbourne Spring Carnival script - C&G Calligraphy (similar to El Greco) {Mark S}
content:
Hello Folks,  
I’ve thrown everything I know at this one and come up blank. Client says it’s called “CGA” but there’s no such font AFAICT. MyFonts.com WTF couldn’t pick it. Is it a custom face?

Regards  
PAUL  
SkyRocket Design Co  
 [Web design :: Dee Why](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406132911/http:/www.skyrocket.com.au/)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [SpringCarnival.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406132911/http:/typophile.com/files/SpringCarnival.jpg) | 83.75 KB |

 [‹ (x) Yves Saint Laurent logo - custom lettering by Adolphe Cassandre {Anastas}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406132911/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15203 "Go to previous forum topic") [What font does the DIA use for their corporate logo? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406132911/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15200 "Go to next forum topic")
author: skyrocket

comments.content:
I think this is an old Casady & Greene font from their “Fluent Fonts” collection, one of the earliest sets of third party PostScript fonts. I don’t know the name of it, though.

Since they closed their doors a couple of years ago (after selling their SoundJam MP3 player to Apple as a basis for iTunes), I don’t know what’s become of their fonts. Their former web address ( [http://www.casadyg.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406132911/http:/www.casadyg.com/ "http://www.casadyg.com/")) is now one of those horrible generic web portals and has nothing to do with the original organization (not unlike [http://www.typographi.ca](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406132911/http:/www.typographi.ca/ "http://www.typographi.ca")).

Edit: Actually, the collection was called “Fluent Laser Fonts” and the font in question was called Calligraphy. More about them [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406132911/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/casady_greene/index.htm), including the actual fonts which are apparently in the public domain now.

Incidentally, C&G’s Calligraphy is, in fact, a poorly drawn copy of El Greco, a face designed for H. Berthold in 1964 by Gunter Gerhard Lange. If you want the real thing (which is about a hundred times higher quality) you can get it from [Phil’s Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406132911/http:/www.philsfonts.com/detail.html?sku=AB80395003P1).

Hello Mark,

C&G Calligraphy/El Greco looks to be spot on. Thank you very much - brilliant pick(s) & much appreciated. Interesting stuff about SoundJam too!

Regards  
PAUL  
SkyRocket Design Co
